title: Ticket #1491: config knob USE_NFS not up-to-date
description:
From a 6-4-2010 condor-users post: 
On 06/03/2010 12:27 PM, Gabriele Foerstner wrote:
> > We changed our condor version from 6.8.6 to 7.4.1 and now our condor
> > jobs get very often the following error messages written in the log file:
> >
> > 007 (016.022.000) 06/03 16:05:17 Shadow exception!
> >         Error from slot3@htc5409.esrf.fr: Assertion ERROR on (result)
> >         0  -  Run Bytes Sent By Job
> >
> > The message may even show up several times for the same process.
> >
> > The ShadowLog shows the following Error:
> > 06/03 16:26:17 (16.39) (18909): ERROR "Error from slot4@htc5413.esrf.fr:
> > Assertion ERROR on (result)" at line 655 in file pseudo_ops.cpp
> >
> > The processes get rescheduled, as as they might get even rescheduled
> > several times, the execution time of a job cluster is more than twice as
> > long.
> >
> > Version 6.8.6 was running on RedhatE4 (64-bit AMD hosts), and 7.4.1 is
> > running on RedhatE5 (64-bit AMD hosts).
> > I tested as well version 7.4.2, but it didn't help.
> >
> > We run only vanilla jobs.
> > As most of our jobs are very I/O intensive, so we use NFS to avoid
> > network traffic (USE_NFS = True).
> >
> >
> > Thanks for your help
> >    Gabriele

Not helpful wrt your error, just at note on USE_NFS because I see so many people referencing it -

 According to the manual, it is primarily for the Standard Universe,

  http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.5/3_3Configuration.html#15625

That said, a quick spin through the code suggests that USE_NFS is used by chirp
 in the Vanilla Universe and probably Parallel Universe. The manual could
 probably use with some updating, and the param could use a more specific name.

Best,


matt

Doing 

grep -r USE_NFS *
turns up the suspect instances 
condor_examples/condor_config.generic:#USE_NFS          = False
condor_examples/condor_config.submit.generic:#USE_NFS           = False
condor_examples/hawkeye_config:#USE_NFS         = False
condor_scripts/condor_glidein:USE_NFS = False
condor_shadow.std/README:               USE_NFS                         Whether this machine uses NFS file system. If the
condor_shadow.std/shadow.cpp:   use_nfs = param( "USE_NFS" );
condor_shadow.V6.1/baseshadow.cpp:      tmp = param("USE_NFS");
condor_shadow.V6.1/baseshadow.h:                        USE_AFS, USE_NFS, and CKPT_SERVER_HOST.
condor_shadow.V6.1/pseudo_ops.cpp:      if( !lookup_boolean_param("USE_NFS") ) {
condor_tests/x_condor_config_template:#USE_NFS          = False

From this, Pete will place into this ticket info on what, if anything, needs to change in the documentation of USE_NFS, and then reassign the ticket to Karen.
